More help online at studiocode.dev/mercury7/editor/help/.

Instructions

  1. Allow the browser to access your MIDI devices.
  2. Connect your Mercury7 to the MIDI adapter.
  3. Select input & output devices and MIDI channel.
  4. Move a knob on your Mercury7, the corresponding on-screen control must move accordingly.
    • To move the knobs, use the mouse.
    • Click and drag over the knob. You can also use the mousewheel.

Keyboard shortcuts:

  • ESC: close dialogs and settings
  • 0..9: presets 1..10
  • Right, +: next preset
  • Left, -: previous preset
  • Alt: keep pressed to view raw values
  • SPACE BAR: BYPASS on/off
  • S: SWELL
  • I: Init
  • R: Randomize
  • PageUp: EXP max
  • PageDn: EXP min
  • TAB: toggle EXP values
  • Shift: show EXP values
  • Up, Dn: animate exp
Use Ctrl to play animations until 50%.

Load preset from file

Mercury7 Editor

Still under active development. Feel free to log bugs/issues.

Mercury7 Editor is under GNU General Public License v3.0. View license.

Credits

This editor uses the following Open Source components:

  • WebMidi.js helps you tame the Web MIDI API.
  • svg-knob: a flexible and customizable knob for your web applications.
  • Lity: a lightweight, accessible and responsive lightbox.
  • jQuery: a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library.
  • RxJS: reactive Extensions for modern JavaScript .
  • storejs: local storage localstorage package provides a simple API.
  • detect-browser: unpack a browser type and version from the useragent string.
  • Font Awesome: the iconic font and CSS toolkit.
  • Roboto font by Google.

This editor is not endorsed by, directly affiliated with, maintained, or sponsored by Meris.
